column4: I just installed ntfs-3g and now my CD-RW wont mount, how can I fix this?
I just installed ntfs-3g and now my CD-RW wont mount, how can I fix this?
can anyone help me?
how?
it is a little late now...
I know, just I already installed ntfs-3g
well, I installed ntfs-3g and then went to check if I could use my windows HDD and noticed that my CDRW no longer worked
I tried mounting it manually, but I got this: mount: can't find /media/cdrom1 in /etc/fstab or /etc/mtab
hi, is there a way to switch between KDE and Gnome? (I am using gnome now)
of course... installed kde ?
then kindly install kde -> sudo apt-get install kubuntu-desktop
after that pls log out and in log-in screen change the session to kde :P
nope
i am using gnome but burns cd/dvd with k3b ... a kde app .. i don't care which is better
so then don't forget to get xubuntu too ... its xfce based desktop
did you install kubuntu-desktop cleanly ?
then i ended without any errors ?
then you log out and log in ? hmms ... have youy rebooted though ?
would you mind rebooting once ?
now thats funny ... no idea there
or system -> preference -> themes
btw you mean login window ?
